page.title: 13THE MILL, BERKELEY VALE (2)
page.content: The mill, known as Englands Mills, uses{wheat}grown in the surrounding counties, such as Gloucestershire and Herefordshire, and Canadian wheat. The two are{mixed}to give a{good quality {flour.}This summer though, was a bad one for wheat harvests so supplies were obtained from France and Germany (poorer quality wheat), Australia (an expensive source) and America (also costly). The demand for{stoneground {flour}is actually{increasing,}so these supply difficulties will mean higher flour prices. Due to{EEC prices,}bread and flour are to get a price increase anyway, so all looks gloomy for the consumer. As the market for the mill's products does look good, the future of the mill seems fairly secure. Success has only come for the mill by its own efforts; the Government has given no cash help.
